summary: This is an internal communication from the Chief Pharmacist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's reported lack of access to his prescribed constipation medication (docusate sodium/Colace). The note indicates Epstein was on Psychological Observation at the time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is reported to have stated he has not been receiving his prescribed constipation medication while on Psychological Observation at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's medication filled
events.description: A 30-day supply of docusate sodium 100mg (Colace) was filled for inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein reports missing medication
events.description: An internal note records that inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who is on Psychological Observation, said he has not been receiving his constipation medication.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
Epstein was reported to be on 'Psychological Observation' status at the time.
Epstein stated he had not been receiving his prescribed constipation medication (docusate sodium/Colace).
A 30-day supply of this medication had been filled for him on July 12, 2019.
The document is an official, sensitive internal communication from the facility's Chief Pharmacist, a U.S. Public Health Service officer.
